entries.content: Acknowledge the prospect's initial resistance or statement before proceeding. (Relates to AAA: Acknowledge)
entries.notes: Used when prospect says 'I don't need anything' or states a limitation.

entries.content: I know you don't need anything, but may I have 30 seconds for me to tell you the reason why I called?
entries.notes: Example of acknowledging and then asking for time. (Relates to AAA: Acknowledge, Ask)

entries.content: Ask clarifying questions after a prospect presents an objection or future plan. (Relates to AAA: Ask, and Clarify-Isolate-Overcome: Clarify)
entries.notes: Used after prospect mentions looking into vials 'within the next year'.

entries.content: So that I can best serve you in the future, may I ask why your team is looking into vials?
entries.notes: Example of asking a clarifying question about the underlying reason for a future plan. (Relates to AAA: Ask, and Clarify-Isolate-Overcome: Clarify)

entries.content: Acknowledge the prospect's stated limitations or current situation. (Relates to AAA: Acknowledge)
entries.notes: Used when prospect says 'I only do chemical' or 'I'd rather not get too involved'.
Simple phrase to acknowledge and validate the prospect's statement. (Relates to AAA: Acknowledge)

entries.content: Ask for a referral or alternative contact when the current contact is not the right person. (Relates to AAA: Ask, and handling objections)
entries.notes: Used when prospect says the item doesn't fall in their wheelhouse.

entries.content: Would you know who oversees those items that category by chance?
entries.notes: Example of asking for a referral. (Relates to AAA: Ask)
Reflection on a missed opportunity to push past an objection (timing/future plan) to secure a meeting. (Relates to Overcome in Clarify-Isolate-Overcome)
